channel.title: Code is causing an error? :(
channel.description:
People, yes... I need help... again, lol.
Sorry about this, but, i'm confused.
Im working on code and when i compile it comes up with one error that says: [code]NPCHandler.java:380: illegal start of expression public static boolean IsDropping = false; ^[/code] Above is the error.... I can't figure what is wrong [yeah im a newn :P]
And here is the code on line 380: [code]public static boolean IsDropping = false;[/code]

item.title: Code is causing an error? :(
item.dc:creator: @nathanrfc nathanrfc
item.description:
@nathanrfc wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:2, topic:65596”]Go to NPCHandler.java and do Ctrl+G and put in 380. Then right above that line add a } and after the } you added add another }.
So it’s like this :

} } public static boolean IsDropping = false;[/quote]

It’s still saying ilegal start of expression, and then the line bellow it:

	publicvoid MonsterDropItem;int newItemID, int newItemAmount, int NPCID;

… that line is also causing an error now, it says that the two ‘int’ are ‘expecting an identifier’

Can anyone help on this?

It seems that there is problem. lol

Read full topic

item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Go to NPCHandler.java and do Ctrl+G and put in 380. Then right above that line add a } and after the } you added add another }.
So it’s like this :

} } public static boolean IsDropping = false;
